page.title: 06Flora and Fauna.
page.content: Nearly{300 species}of flowering plants have been recorded on the Reserve. Parts of the reserve are shingle where sea pea covers the ground with pink flowers and the Yellow-horned poppy is plentiful. Plants have had to adapt to bleak conditions and salty ground. The large cabbage_like sea kale is one of the most common plants near the shore. On a walk though the reserve in June,children spotted such plants as Jack by the hedge, Red Clover, Vipers Bugloss and Valerian. Many species of{aquatic flowers}can be seen in the man_made gravel pits that make up much of the reserve. At Castle Waters {,5 types of orchid {grow}in the grassy areas.
